Introduction

Heechul is a South Korean singer, rapper, actor, radio DJ, songwriter and MC under SM Entertainment. He is a member of the boy group SUPER JUNIOR and its sub-unit SUPER JUNIOR-T. He is also part of the project group, M&D along with TRAXX's Jungmo and the duo Universe Cowards with BUZZ's Kyunghoon.

He was originally placed in a four-member group called 'Four Seasons' along with TVXQ's Yunho and Jaejoong and future bandmate Kangin. The group was dropped pre-debut due to Yunho and Jaejoong joining TVXQ. He was later preparing to debut as the main vocalist of rock band TRAXX, but due to frequent clashes and misunderstandings with the people in charge of SM Entertainment at the time, he left Seoul and returned to his hometown in Gangwon Province.

He first made his acting debut in 2004 in the TV drama "Sharp 2" with labelmates Go Ara and future bandmate Kibum.

He is mostly known for hosting variety shows such as Knowing Brothers, Weekly Idol, Lipstick Prince, and A Style for You.

Fun facts

1
Som Dam-Bi gave Heechul the nickname 'Kim Condom" because he always carries her home when she's drunk, so she feels safe with him.
…
2
Heechul has a pet Russian Blue cat named Heebum (born in 2006) and a mixed-breed Jack Russell Terrier named Gibok (born in 2019). He has also fostered orphaned or abandoned animals in the past, including Goblin, the late Sulli's cat, before it was formally adopted by Kim Sun Ah.
…
3
He is close friends with fromis_9 as he was their teacher on the survival show Idol School.
…
4
Heechul was inspired to join an entertainment company after watching PSY perform.
…
5
He is best friends with the solo singer, Son Dam-Bi.
…
6
Heechul is a pro gamer, particularly in his favorite PC game, League of Legends. He has played a celebrity match with 3-time World Champion, SKT T1 in 2015 and is a huge Faker fan.
…
7
In 2011, Heechul wrote the lyrics for Shanghai Romance by Orange Caramel, which became very popular at the time. Thirteen years later, in 2024, influencers and top K-pop idol groups brought the song back into the spotlight, turning it into a viral trend on major video streaming platforms like TikTok and YouTube.
…
